iati-activity.title: NORDIC TRUST FUND ON JUSTICE AND HUMAN RIGHTS IN THE WB (IDA)
iati-activity.description: THIS IS SUPPORT TO THE WORLD BANK'S NORDIC TRUST FUND ON JUSTICE AND HUMAN RIGHTS. THE NORDIC COUNTRIES HAVE INTRODUCED A STRATEGIC HUMAN RIGHTS DIALOGUE WITH THE WORLD BANK, AND HAVE SET UP A TRUST FUND, OUT OF WHICH FUNDS WILL BE RELEASED IN ORDER TO ENHANCE THE HUMAN RIGHTS PERSPECTIVE IN THE BANK AND IN ITS MEMBER COUNTRIES. THE FUND WILL PROMOTE INNOVATIVE MECHANISMS FOR THE MORE EFFECTIVE INCLUSION OF HUMAN RIGHTS CONSIDERATIONS AND THEIR RELATION TO POWERTY REDUCTION.

iati-activity.title: Technical cooperation fund
iati-activity.description: The purpose of the Fund is to finance advisory services and technical cooperation (TC) in respect of projects financed by EBRD in all ODA-eligible countries in Eastern Europe (Moldova, Ukraine, Belarus), Central Asia and Southern Caucasus. The contribution shall preferably be focused on the main sectors of Finlands development policy, such as environment, energy, forestry, agriculture, water and sanitation, regional policy, trade and economic development, as well as information and communication technology.

location.name: ODA-eligible countries in Eastern Europe (Moldova, Ukraine, Belarus), Central Asia and Southern Cauc

iati-activity.title: Support to the Internet Governance Forum (IGF) through UNDESA
iati-activity.description: Funds-in-trust to UNDESA project GLO/96/06X1 (Internet Governance Forum) to implement articles 72-79 of the Tunis Agenda for the Information Society of WSIS that request the UNSG to convene a new forum for multistakeholder policy dialogue on Internet Governance. Two successful fora have been so far, and there will be three more 2008-2010, with growing intersessional activities in the form of self-organizing dynamic coalitions. Participation from developing countries has however been hampered by financial problems, which the IGF Secretariat has tried to alleviate with fellowships and internships, that also provide staff support to the Secretariat.

iati-activity.title: Green Diplomacy; support to UNEP's environmental diplomacy initiative
iati-activity.description: UNEP has been developing the concept of environmental diplomacy for peacebuilding over the past five years. The current project will capitalize on the lessons learned from UNEPs current experience, scale-up operations, and provide a more systematic approach to using environmental diplomacy as a tool for conflict prevention and peacebuilding in countries or regions affected by or vulnerable to conflicts. The overall development aim is to ensure the achievement of sustainable peace in countries emerging out of conflicts as well as preventing natural resource from becoming a source of violence in vulnerable countries and regions. This project (from 2007 to 2009) is funded by the Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland. The total budget of the project is Euro 2 million.

iati-activity.title: European Report on Development (ERD); Finland's contribution 2007-2008
iati-activity.description: The role of European development research in global discussions and its link to EU's policy processes is being strengthened through the Mobilising European Research for Development Policies initiative. This is implemented in the form of a European Report on Development project. The ERD is an EU Commission initiative made in 2006, and it will be implemented as a joint project between the Commission and Member States. The result will be an annual, critically analytical research report. The ERD which will be prepared during 2007-2008 will focus on how the MDGs reconcile with new global challenges. The focus is in particular on Africa and the role and action of the EU in Africa.
iati-activity.participating-org: European Commission - Development Share of Budget

iati-activity.title: Resources Assessment Process (FRA 2010)
iati-activity.description: There are high expectations on the world_s forests related to the economic_ social and environmental aspects of forest resources. In poor countries_ highly dependent on agriculture forests and forest policies are closely linked to (gender) equality_ democracy and good governance. Climate change has increased the need for forest related information. Purpose of the four years Forest Resources Assessment project of the FAO is to collect accurate_ comprehensive and comparable information on deforestation and degradation of forests globally. Project also aims to build forest related assessment and reporting capacities of developing countries. Project will substantially contribute to the discussion on climate change.

iati-activity.title: Sustainable Forest Management in a Changing Climate
iati-activity.description: The programme focuses on sustainable forest management in changing climate at global level and in programme partner countries at national level and intends to build capacity_ test and develop methodologies on national level and deliver the best practices and methods to serve globally through FAO and other development partners. The programme catalyses national actions in cooperation with other donors in the country level to enhance the Sustainable Forest Management (SFM) in changing climate_ to contribute to environment and human well-being.

iati-activity.title: Support to PARIS21
iati-activity.description: To strengthen statistical capacity in developing countries in order to monitor for instance progress in achieving Millennium Development Goals.

iati-activity.title: Gender and Climate Change in International Climate Policy
iati-activity.description: Finland considers that gender aspects are important in work against climate change. Finland promotes the recognition of the needs of women_ eg. adaptation with regards to climate change as well as the participation of women in climate change related decision making. Finland wants to influence on the promotion of gender aspects of climate change in topical climate discussions and negotiations. In this regards Aira Kalela will work as an Expert Consultant in Climate Change and Gender -project from 1 April 2008 to 31 December 2009. Ms Kalelas work will be supported by 110.000.

iati-activity.title: Ingo Aid to the Earth Negotiations Bulletin
iati-activity.description: International Institute for Sustainable Development writes and publishes the Earth Negotiations Bulletin. The ENB is a reporting service for environment and development negotiations. It is the main source of information for many parties_ especially developing country parties. ENB provides realtime information to decision makers and promotes transparency in multilateral policy making. The production of ENB is supported by contributions from governments_ UN agencies and private organisations.

iati-activity.title: Strengthening of impact of multilateral development cooperation
iati-activity.description: Strengthening of impact of multilateral development cooperation. Support to costs for environment related seminars and other activities.

iati-activity.title: Visits to Finland by journalists from developing countries
iati-activity.description: The project aims at identifying opportunities to invite journalists from developing countries to participate in courses_ seminars and individual press tours to fulfil the objectives described above. The Department for Press and Cultural Affairs applies for budgetary means from cooperation funds in order to implement a programme to invite journalists from developing countries. The programme aims at building networks between Finland and developing partnership countries as well as between Finnish journalists and journalists from developing countries. In this way_ the programme supports the fulfilment of UN Millenium Development Goals. The overarching objective is to support the social and economic development of developing countries.
iati-activity.sector: Media and free flow of information

iati-activity.title: Ingo Aid for training of civil servants in Moldova and Georgia
iati-activity.description: Project is financing scholarships for two groups of three young Moldovan and two Georgian civil servants/diplomats to study at ESD (Estonian School of Acadamy) in the academic years 2008/2009 and 2009/2010. The scholarship covers all expenses related to participation in the ESD nine-months (60 ECTS) training course International Relations and European Integration.

iati-activity.title: Supporting action on climate change in Southeast Asia
iati-activity.description: The project will use a regional networking approach to improve the development and exchange of knowledge among climate change focal points and climate change professionals in countries in Southeast Asia. By fostering interaction and exchange of experience among climate change professionals and giving them the means to conduct joint analysis of climate change issues and options of particular interest or concern_ the project will speed development of good policies_ foster the sharing of best practices and information_ and accelerate the transfer of climate friendly technologies.

iati-activity.title: Support for Delhi Sustainable Development Summit 2009
iati-activity.description: The DSDS organized by TERI one of the most significant annual conferences on sustainable development. The high-level conference_ which gives considerable emphasis on climate issues in developing countries supports the international climate negotiations process_ promotes environmental awareness_ advances dialogue between industrial and developed countries and gives unparalleled access to climate discourse in India. Support for DSDS advances all these goals_ which rank highly on the Finnish agenda for international development.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Building Capacity of Partner Organizations
iati-activity.description: To increase knowledge on Child Participation and Evaluation of Partner NGOs in Colombia_India_Nepal and Thailand by arranging a training seminar in Finland.

iati-activity.title: EU Forest Law Enforcement Governance and Trade Partnership
iati-activity.description: To support EU FLEGT Partnership agreements in developing countries_ through multi-donor FLEGT Support Facility. Aim is to assist developing countries to enter into and implement effective partnership agreements with the EU under the auspices of the FLEGT Action Plan_ through the provision of facilitation services and technical assistance to indicate the programmes ands to verify and monitor its implementation.

iati-activity.description: Donation of two occupational health clinic buses in Vietnam and Macedonia.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Making Marghinalized Voices heard in UN Climate Process
iati-activity.description: The project aims to empower marginalized groups in India_ Tanzania_ Brazil and Finland to create new mechanisms to affect to the international political processes combating climate change and to strenghten appreciation to sustainable lifestyles. The tools udes in the project are capacity building through grass root research work_ two level workshops_ video exercise that tests new technologies and participation to formal political processes.

iati-activity.title: Trade and Development/UN Global Compact
iati-activity.description: The United Nations Global Compact Trust Fund supports the work of the Global Compact Office and global activities. UNGC advances the implementation of Finland_s development policy through thematic Aid for Trade (AFT). The private sector_s commitment to Corporate Social Responsibility in the framework of the ten UNGC principles on human rights_ labour_ the environment and anti-corruption integrates the cross-cutting themes into Finland_s AFT. UNGC improves the role of the UN System in Finland_s multilateral AFT. UNGC can also_ for its own part_ reduce risks related to partnerships between the state and businesses in development cooperation.
iati-activity.participating-org: UNITED NATIONS AGENCIES, FUNDS AND COMMISSIONS

iati-activity.title: Support for GGCA for Gender Mainstreaming in Global Climate
iati-activity.description: The effects of climate change are felt strongest by the poorest and the most vulnerable_ of whom a majority is women. Women are_ however_ also a significant and underutilized resource in meeting the challenge of climate change. The Global Gender and Climate Alliance brings together key UN actors in the field of international environmental and development policy to address the question of gender and climate change. Its main goal is a more widespread recognition of a gender perspective in decision making and policy planning related to climate change_ which should lead to an enhancement of the condition of women with respect to climate change. Finland has a high profile in integrating a gender perspective to climate policy and the activities of GGCA thus support our own climate and development policy goals in a significant manner.

iati-activity.title: EUEI/Partnership Dialogue Facility_ PDF
iati-activity.description: Finland has been actively developing the EU Energy Initiative (EUEI) with some other member states. Finnish project _Energy and Environment Partnership with Central America_ is a good example of the member states_ own projects under EUEI. To develope energy policies and strategies the Partnership Dialogue Facility (PDF) - instrument has been developed. PDF supports developing countries in sub-Saharan Africa and elsewhere to design policies and action-oriented regional_ national and sub-national strategies in order to create an enabling environment and platform for government_ private sector and donor-funded investments in improved energy access.

iati-activity.description: The mission of the Information for Development Program (infoDev) is to help developing countries and their international partners use information and communication broadly and effectively as tools of poverty reduction and sustainable economic growth. InfoDev’s work program focuses on three closely related themes: (i) Mainstreaming ICT as a Tool of Development and Poverty Reduction_(ii) Enabling Access for All_ (iii) Entrepreneurship_ Innovation and Growth.

iati-activity.title: OECD/DAC Evaluation of Paris Declaration, Phase II
iati-activity.description: Participation in the second phase of the joint evaluation of Paris Declaration. The evaluation aims at clarifying the linkage between effectiveness of development aid and development effectiveness.

iati-activity.title: MOPAN Common Approach
iati-activity.description: The Multilateral Organization Performance Assessment Network (MOPAN) was created in 2002 as a network of like-minded donor countries with a common interest to monitor and assess the work and performance of Multilateral Organisations (MOs); conducting annual surveys (the Annual MOPAN Survey) on MOs through their embassies.From 2009 onwards MOPAN wishes to broaden the survey by undertaking a three-year assessment, analysis, and reporting process (called the Common Approach or CA) of the effectiveness of selected multilateral organizations (MOs). The assessment process will be undertaken simultaneously in 10 countries, with up to 6 different MOs annually from 2009 to 2013. The funding of the project will be chanelled through DFID(UK).

iati-activity.title: Natural Disaster and Climate Change in Finnish Aid
iati-activity.description: The evaluation looks at the Finnish aid to the prevention and preparedness of natural disasters and climate change from the perspective of the goal of poverty reduction. One of the major entry points to the question is aid to the sector of meteorology and hydrology.

iati-activity.title: Evaluation of the Finnish Development Cooperation in Water Sec.
iati-activity.description: Evaluation of experiences and lessons learned from aid interventions to the sector during the period 1995-2008 with emphasis on the current decade. As the evaluation is future oriented strategic evaluation the aid modalities and approaches shall be assessed taking into account the global problems in the sustainable use of water resources and the possible influence of climate change adaptation on future approaches and choice of aid modalities/instruments.
iati-activity.sector: Water resources policy and administrative management

iati-activity.title: Preliminary study on forestry sector evaluation
iati-activity.description: Preliminary study and survey of documents and other materials relevant to forestry sector development cooperation of Finland.

iati-activity.title: Evaluation of Finnish Concessional Aid Instruments
iati-activity.description: The objective of this evaluation is to gain information on the environmental effects of concessional credit projects given The Development Policy Programme 2007 which states that development should be sustainable also environmentally. In addition, the objective is to have an overall picture of how the concessional credit instrument has evolved during the 21st century and gain information on lessons learned which can be used as a tool for institutional learning in the future. Evaluation of Finnish Concessional Aid Instruments is topical because the instrument is to be revised. Previous evaluations of concessional credit instrument were conducted in 2003 and 1999.

iati-activity.title: Sustainability in the Finnish Aid
iati-activity.description: Evaluation of Sustainability in addressing Poverty Reduction comprises of 1) a Synthesis evaluation of all evaluations carried out in 2008-09and including the ongoing evaluations to be completed in 2010 2) two thematic evaluations to be carried out in 2010 (forestry and energy), which shall be included also in the synthesis evaluation. The purpose of the evaluation is to assess how the principles of sustainable development and theri application affect the poverty reduction.

iati-activity.title: IDA-15 replenishment
iati-activity.description: Finland's contribution to the IDA-15 replenishment.

iati-activity.title: Strengthening the efficiency of funding policy
iati-activity.description: Strengthening the efficiency of funding policy, administrative costs.

iati-activity.title: Support to the development and piloting of an Open source Cadastre
iati-activity.description: Securing land tenure and access to land is vital for development. Security of tenure encourages long term investments on land and creates incentives for sustainable rural development. An effective and transparent land administration has an important role in ensuring the security of tenure. However in several developing countries, land administrations fail to secure land tenure rights of the poor. The project aims to improve poor rural people's access to land by developing sustainable land administration systems in countries with limited financial resources. The implementation of the project will focus on 1)Development of an Open Source Cadastre and Registration Shell;2) Piloting the product in three countries;3)Building an online user community and 4) Ensuring technical support and software maintenance.The duration of the project is three years and its budget is about 2 million.

iati-activity.title: Making agriculture part of the solution to climate change-Building
iati-activity.description: Agriculture and land use are responsible of around 30 percent of the emissions and have a significant potential for mitigation. The goal of the project is to enable countries to better realize the opportunities of climate change mitigation in agriculture while improving food security and increasing resilience of farming systems at the same time. The project implementation can be divided into five modules: 1) Better knowledge support 2) Increased awareness, participation and partnerships; 3) Strengthened technical consultative processes; 4) developed communities of practices and 5) Development and advice on options. The duration of the project is five years (2010-2014) and the total budget is about 40 000 000 Euros.

iati-activity.title: IDLO Trade policy capacity building
iati-activity.description: International Development Law Organization IDLO support developing coutries and countries with economies in transition to build their capacity in negotiations in order to advance int. trade, investments and int. business transactions.

iati-activity.title: Follow-up and Overview of Concessional Credits
iati-activity.description: Follow-up and Overview of Concessional Credits; travelcosts and assignments.

iati-activity.title: Commissioned Development Policy Research 2009
iati-activity.description: The approach and particular emphasis of the projects are discussed with the researchers, without hampering their academic freedom. The duration of projects varies between 3-12 months. Each project is supported by a Steering Group consisting of sector and area experts. The results of projects are discussed in public seminars with the research community, civil servants and civil society actors.

iati-activity.title: UNIDO's trust fund for strengthening of the trade capacity of development
iati-activity.description: As part of Finland's multilateral trade and development related assistance, it is proposed to support UNIDO's technical cooperation activities in 2010 by EUR 1.2 million. Finland's support is split into three parts: support to trade related capacity buidling; support towards agri-business programmes; and support to UNIDO's investment and technology programmes.

iati-activity.title: Women in International Climate Policy
iati-activity.description: Climate change is a serious threat to reduction of poverty and the achievement of the Millennium Development Goals. Its effects are felt strongest by the world's poorest and the weakest, of whom some 70% are women. Women can, however, have a significant impact on climate change. Forestation and increased use of renewable energy play a key role in mitigation. More widespread use of sustainable agricultural and water management principles could contribute greatly to climate adaptation. Food production and the provision of household water and energy are typically managed by women in developing countries. Empowering women can thus render climate action more effective. A key objective for Finland in climate talks is strengthening women's potential for mitigating climate change and adapting to it; this should be reflected in all climate change work programmes and funding arrangements.

iati-activity.title: UN Forum on forests UNFF
iati-activity.description: In October 2000, the Economic and Social Council of the United Nations (ECOSOC), in its Resolution 2000/35 established the United Nations Forum on Forests (UNFF), a subsidiary body with the main objective to promote; the management, conservation and sustainable development of all types of forests and to strengthen long-term political commitment to this end;based on the Rio Declaration, the Forest Principles, Chapter 11 of Agenda 21 and the outcome of the IPF/IFF Processes and other key milestones of international forest policy. the Seventh Session of the Forum adopted the landmark Non-Legally Binding Instrument on All Types of Forests on 28 April 2007. http://www.un.org/esa/forests.
iati-activity.participating-org: UNITED NATIONS AGENCIES, FUNDS AND COMMISSIONS

iati-activity.title: UN Secretary-General's Change Support Team (CCST)
iati-activity.description: The UN Secretary-General's activities on climate change can be supported by funding the SG's Climate Change Support Team (CCST). As a significant result, the SG can play a pro-active role in ensuring successful climate negotiations in Copenhagen and increasing the awareness on climate change. The SG-led coherent UN System will be recognized as an effective partner in climate activities and climate change issues will be mainstreamed into relevant processes and development plans. According to the Finnish Development Policy, Finland promotes the cooperation to combat climate change. Finland endorses the United Nations' role as the most important actor in international development policy and support for CCST contributes to that goal. In the year 2009, CCST's activities are funded with 200 000 Euros.
iati-activity.participating-org: UNITED NATIONS AGENCIES, FUNDS AND COMMISSIONS

iati-activity.title: North-South capacity building of higher education institutions
iati-activity.description: Insitutional cooperation between Finnish and partner country insitutions of higher education aims at building administrative and teaching capacity of partner institutions and at strengthening north-south cooperation. Cooperation provides opportunities for utilising Finnish know-how in the domaine of higher education and enables long-standing parnerships and mutual learning.

iati-activity.title: Voluntary Contribution to OECD/DAC Poverty Reduction
iati-activity.description: Support to the poverty reduction activities of the OECD, in particular the analytical work to implement the Work Programme of 2009-10.

iati-activity.title: Voluntary Contribution to OECD/DAC Environment
iati-activity.description: The work of OECD/DAC/ENVIRONET is support. ENVIRONET analyses the environmental links of development cooperation and produces guidelines; during 2009-10 especially on issues related to climate change.

iati-activity.title: Voluntary contribution to OECD/DAC Aid Effectiveness
iati-activity.description: The OECD Development Assistance Committee (DAC) promotes the international aid effectiveness agenda by way of monitoring progress of the Paris Declaration and hosting the Working Party on Aid Effectiveness. Finland regards the OECD's aid effectiveness work as highly valuable and central to the entire aid effectiveness agenda.

iati-activity.title: Meta-analysis of Development Evaluations 2007-2008
iati-activity.description: Horizontal meta-analysis of evaluations carried out in 2007-2008 in the ministry. The meta-analysis comprises evaluation reports of the regional departments and the central evaluation function.

iati-activity.title: Trade and Development /Funding for a frame agreement of consultant
iati-activity.description: Funding for a frame agreement of an external consultant to support the implementation of Aid for Trade.

iati-activity.title: MFA's Support to Finnish Water Forum
iati-activity.description: Finnish Water Forum (FWP) project will be established in order to promote the achievement of internationally agreed Millennium Development Goals and to make sure that also Finnish water experts will be able to do their part. The Ministry for Foreign Affairs will cover 40 % of the total costs (which support developing countries and are according to ODA-criteria). This money will be used for activities which support the developing world. FWF will begin in the first half of year 2009 and will last from 2009 to 2012. Main focus of the FWF will cover the following themes: water and sanitation, water and environment, water and society, water-related problems in the developing world, climate change and water and Integrated Water Resource Management (IWRM).
iati-activity.sector: Water resources policy and administrative management

iati-activity.title: Aid for Trade for Central Asia, South Caucasus and Eastern Europe
iati-activity.description: UNDP shall implement the flagship project on the theme Aid For Trade in the framework of Wider Europe Initiative. The first phase of the programme (2009-2010) consists of three components: 1) Aid for Trade Road Map in Central Asia: Identification of national and regional AfT priorities, 2) Support to Economic Development along Trade Corridors, 3) AfT Needs Assessments in Eastern Europe and Central Asia. The phase I shall provide a background for broader AfT support during the Phase II (2010-2013).

iati-activity.description: UN ECOSOC 2nd Development Cooperation Forum, DCF.

iati-activity.description: Planning and monitoring of multilateral aid for trade.

iati-activity.description: Environment and Security Initiative, ENVSEC.

iati-activity.title: Gender at the OECD Development Centre
iati-activity.description: The purpose of this project is to strengthen the mainstreaming of Gender into all OECD activities and to reach wider audiences on gender mainstreaming. The objective is to futher develop gender indicators, database and website. The objective is more effective policy making as well as the awareness raising of wider audiences. The project includes mainstreaming of gender across OECD activities and further developing the Gender in Development -database as well as expanding wikigender interactive website and publication of a Gender Atlas.

iati-activity.title: UNCTAD Panel of Eminent Persons
iati-activity.description: Panel of Eminent Persons drafts recomendations for improving UNCTAD's work.

iati-activity.title: Wider Europe Initiative; Security and Development Research
iati-activity.description: A new cluster will be formed for operations maintaining and strengthening security. This cluster will consist of research institutions active in the field of foreign and security policy.

iati-activity.title: Strenghtening the capacity for UN development issues of the SIDS
iati-activity.description: The SIDS countries have inadequate capacity to respond to the hectic and demanding development agenda of the UN. The objective of the project is to increase the SIDS countries capacity to better handle UN development issues, increasing their possibilities to influence the reached outcomes. The project is implemented by financing two experts who will be working in the permanent Mission to the UN of Nauru for two years 1.3.2010-28.2.2012. Additionally the terms of references of the hired experts are made flexible enough, to correspond to the needs of the SIDS countries. The duration of the project is 2 years and the budget is 200 000 Euros.
iati-activity.participating-org: UNITED NATIONS AGENCIES, FUNDS AND COMMISSIONS

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Developing Europeans' engagement for eradication of global
iati-activity.description: Developing Europeansengagement for eradication of global poverty, through education, advocacy, campaigning.

iati-activity.title: Special Climate Change Fund (SCCF)
iati-activity.description: Additional contributions to support UNFCCC climate fund SCCF (Special Climate Change Fund) hosted by the GEF. Contribution support adaptation measures through the SCCF in those vulnerable developing countries that are not LDCs which can receive support from the LDCF. Additional contribution is part of the EU financing strategy in Bali COP13. Adaptation is one of the most important negotiation item of the conference and one of the building blocks of the post-2012 climate regime.

iati-activity.title: Least Developed Countries Fund (LDCF)
iati-activity.description: Additional contributions to support UNFCCC climate fund LDCF (Least Developed Countries Fund) hosted by the GEF. Contribution support adaptation measures in least developing countries. Additional contribution is part of the EU financing strategy in Bali COP13. Adaptation is one of the most important negotiation item of the conference and one of the building blocks of the post-2012 climate regime.

iati-activity.title: Gender-sensitive labour migration policies awareness raising
iati-activity.description: The main objectives of the project ar to raise political awareness on a senior policy making level of the importance of including gender-sensitive measures into labout migration policies an in bi- and multilateral agreements and to build stronger instituional capacity through training mid-level government officals, social partners and others.

iati-activity.title: OECD/Policy Coherence for Development
iati-activity.description: Policy Coherence for Development is one of the guiding principles of Finnish Development policy. Hence, it is a priority for Finland in the OECD and DAC work. The Finnish contribution to this work is meant to support the development of better assessment methodologies of results achieved in promoting policy coherence for development as well as the analyses and policy guidance in the areas of agriculture and development; information technology and development; and migration and development. It is suggested that the Finnish government will make available as voluntary contribution to the OECD Programme on Policy Coherence for Development under the Secretary General office in the Work and Budget 2009-2010 100 000 Euros.

iati-activity.title: Wider Europe Initiative; Strategic Cooperation Programmefor Finland
iati-activity.description: Wider Europe Initiative: Strategic Cooperation Programme for Finland's Water Sector Support to the EECCA countries 2009 - 2013. The cooperation programme will be administered by the Finnish Environment Institute.

location.name: Central Asia and South Caucasus and Eastern Europe

iati-activity.sector: Water resources policy and administrative management

iati-activity.title: Support to UNDP Global Thematic Programme on Anti-Corruption for Devel
iati-activity.description: Support to UNDP Global Thematic Programme on Anti-Corruption for Development Effectiveness (PACDE) 2008-2011. This programme aims to increase state/institutional capacity to engage more effectively in reducing corruption to improve governance and sustain development. PACDE focuses both on strenghtening the role of the media and civil society to mobilize the citizenry to participate in the governance of public affairs and at the same time, it seeks to establish long-term systemic changes within and among public institutions.

iati-activity.title: InfoDev Single Trust Fund
iati-activity.description: The goal of the programme Creating Sustainable Businesses in the Knowledge Economy is to increase the productivity capacity of SMES to complete effectively in todays global knowledge economy and contribute to sustainable development.

iati-activity.title: Decentand Safe Jobs
iati-activity.description: The project is aimed at assisting the national partners (Government, Trade Unions and Employers Organisations) in Central Asia and South Cacasus to put into practise the prioritites that they have themselves identified in the pursuit of Decent Work.

iati-activity.title: Sustainable Buildings policies in Developing Countries
iati-activity.description: Buildings account for over a third of all energy consumption and thus generate a significant amount of green house gases. Sustainable buildings can effectively reduce the emission of green house gases with small costs. UNEP proposes to start a project to support sustainable buildings in developing countries. The project will also aim to support the implementation of international climate treaties and sustainable consumption. The project will help authorities in developing countries to identify packages of policy instruments for sustainable buildings.

iati-activity.title: Donor Committee for Enterprise Development, DCED
iati-activity.description: DCED therefore works; Defining best practice in priority themes in participatory ways; Disseminating best practice successful experiences; Increasing the effectiveness of development practitioners. This technical focus contributes to realization of the Paris Declaration on Effectiveness, which aims to ensure that donors' actions are harmonized, transparent collectively effective. The DCED works to achieve these objectives; Responding to members shared interests needs to serve their clients constituents in government, the private sector civil society in developing countries.

iati-activity.title: Agricultural Research for Development, European Research Area II
iati-activity.description: The objective of ERA ARD II is to increase EU's contribution to global agricultural research by strenghtening the intra-EU cooperation on agricultural research for development (ARD) and contribute to improving the effectiveness of achieving the MDGs. Increasing EU cooperation in development cooperation and objectives of EU ERA-ARD programn are in line with Finland's Development Policy Programme (2007). ERA ARD's research programs start in 2011 and their duration is two years. Finlan'd planned contribution is 250 000 euros. The share of Ministry for Foreign Affairs is 200 000 euros for 2011 and share of Ministry for Agriculture and Forestry is 50 000 euros for 2012. Ministry for Agriculture and Forestry is the administrator of the project in Finland.

iati-activity.title: One UN social Protection Floor-Initiative
iati-activity.description: The UN-Reform is moving towards the goal of Delivering as One: UN-Agencies and IFIs are joining forces to build a social protection floor for all - to turn into reality the Articles 22-27 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights. UN-Agencies and IFIs have jointly planned a Manual to guide the work of One-UN Country Offices on approaches to be taken to develop basic social services and transfers. After the 12-18 months' development phase the costs are supposed to be financed from the UN-DAF country budgets. This project will finance the costs of the piloting phase, including 2 major participatory planning events for representatives of developing country governments, UN country teams and HQs, plus a website and other dissemination work.

iati-activity.title: Strengthening of cross-cutting themes in the work of the South Centre
iati-activity.description: South Centre (SC) is a joint think-tank of developing country governments. It supports the negotiators of developing country governments by providing them with research and background information on various global governance issues. It thereby significantly influences the negotiation positions of the G77+China group. This project strengthens the capacity of SC to include cross-cutting equality and human rights themes in its work and its outcomes (experts, publications, events, advisory work).

iati-activity.title: Business linkage programme (Finnpartnership)
iati-activity.description: Unallocated

iati-activity.title: The UNESCO Institute for Statistics (UIS) provides a wide range of policy-relevant, timely, and reliable statistics in the fields of education, science and technology, culture and communication.
iati-activity.description: The UNESCO Institute for Statistics (UIS) was established in July 1999 to meet the growing needs of UNESCO Member States and the international community for a wider range of policy-relevant, timely, and reliable statistics in the fields of education, science and technology, culture and communication. The Institute's functional autonomy, together with the maintenance of high professional standards and intellectual independence, enables it to respond effectively to these needs. The UNESCO Institute for Statistics is hosted by the University of Montreal in Canada.
iati-activity.participating-org: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organisation (UNESCO)

iati-activity.title: Support to the follow-up of the implementation of the results of the World Summit on Information Society (2003, 2005), UNCTAD
iati-activity.description: The project supports the follow-up of the implementation of the results of the World Summit on Information Society (2003, 2005), of which ECOSOC is in charge, assisted by the Commission on Science and Technology for Development (CSTD), one of its functional commissions. Its Secretariat is provided by the Department of Science and Technology of UNCTAD. To redeem its lack of appropriate expertise in the ICT/Informaton Society field, the project proposes to reinforce its capacity in this field by funding a L7-levelt consultant for the substantial preparation of the CSTD meetings. It also aims at helping CSTD members from developing countries to particiopate at the CSTD meetings.
iati-activity.participating-org: United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD)

iati-activity.title: Support to UNESCO's International Programme for the Development of Communication (IPDC)
iati-activity.description: Support to UNESCO's International Programme for the Development of Communication (IPDC). IPDC encourage the free flow of information, at international as well as national levels, promote the wider and better balanced dissemination of information, without any obstacle to freedom of expression, and strengthen communication capacities in the developing countries in order to increase their participation in the communication process.
iati-activity.participating-org: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organisation (UNESCO)

iati-activity.title: Global Alliance for ICT and Development
iati-activity.description: Support for UNDESA project Global Alliance for ICT and Development.

iati-activity.title: Eastern Europe Energy Efficiency and Environment Partnership Fund
iati-activity.description: The purpose of the Fund is to allow harmonised and effective delivery of international financial support over several years by pooling non-reimbursable contributions from a group of donors and beneficiaries, to be used primarily for supporting energy efficiency and environmental projects in the countries within the EU Eastern Partership region.
iati-activity.participating-org: European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD)

iati-activity.title: Support to International Trade Centre (ITC)
iati-activity.description: The International Trade Centre (ITC) is a key partner to Finland with regards to Aid for Trade assistance through multilateral channels. As the development partner for small business export success, ITCs goal is to help developing and transition countries achieve sustainable human development through exports. It is proposed that Finland's support to ITC in 2010 is EUR 1.6 million and in 2011 EUR 1.8 million.

iati-activity.title: NEPAD OECD Africa Investment Initiative
iati-activity.description: The NEPAD-OECD Africa Investment Initiative supports African countries in improving their capacity to identify and implement concrete policy reforms that strengthen the investment climate. The Initiative is guided by the overall objectives of job creation and poverty reduction in line with the Millenium Development Goals (MDGs) and the Monterey Consensus commitments. It takes advantage of the OECD peer learning method and investment policy tools such as the Policy Framework for Investment (PFI). The work of the Initiative is overseen and supported by the OECD Investment Committee and the NEPAD Steering Committee.

iati-activity.title: REDD Partnership
iati-activity.description: Interim Partnerhip for Reducing Emissions from Deforestation and Forest Degradation (REDD+).
iati-activity.participating-org: United Nations Collaborative Programme on Reducing Emissions from Deforestation

iati-activity.title: IUCN-Finland Framework agreement
iati-activity.description: Framework agreement between Finland and IUCN will strengthen developing countries' capacity to integrate environmental objectives into development programmes, in particular in areas/sector where Finland's development policy goals and IUCN's strategic objectives are especially strongly in synergy. These include biodiversity, climate change, environment and security in natural resource management, poverty reduction,renewable natural resources in development: forests, water, agriculture and sustainable land management.

iati-activity.title: UNCTAD Trust Funds for Research and Technical Assistance
iati-activity.description: Helping developing countries in various aspects to integrate into the world economy and trade.
iati-activity.participating-org: United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD)

iati-activity.title: UNIDO's trust fund for strengthening of the trade capacity of deve
iati-activity.description: As part of Finland's multilateral trade and development related assistance, it is proposed to support UNIDO's trade related capacity building in 2009 by EUR 1.2 million. Finland's support is split into three parts: 1) support to the Trust Fund for Trade Related Capacity Building; 2) support to UNIDO's Trade Capacity-Building Programme; and 3) agri-business programmes.

iati-activity.title: Integrated framework for trade-related technical assistance to LDC
iati-activity.description: Support to the Enhanced Integrated Framework (EIF) for Trade Trade Related Assistance for Least Developed Countries. Integration of trade to the development and poverty reduction plans of the least developed countries. Coordination of trade-related technical assistance. Finland's proposed support to the EIF is EUR 2 million in 2010 and EUR 2,3 million in 2011.

iati-activity.title: WTO Trade-related technical assistance
iati-activity.description: WTO technical assistance programme in order to support developing countries' capacity to negotiate, implement and benefit from WTO agreements

iati-activity.title: IEG Int. Environmental Governance, reform group
iati-activity.description: Support to the Consultative Group of Ministers of IEG Int. Environmental Governance reform group, established by UNEP in February 2010.

iati-activity.title: UN Secretary-General's High Level Panel on Global Sustainability
iati-activity.description: The High Level Panel on Global Sustainability, set up by the UN Secretary-General, has a mandate to present a new vision of how to create a concrete development model that is based on green economy. This model should support eradication of poverty, social equality and solving of environmental challenges. The Panel feeds ideas into the preparations for the UN Conference on Sustainable Development (Rio+20), to be held in Rio de Janeiro in 2012. According to Finland's Development Policy Programme, the principles of sustainable development should be followed and obeyed in all activity influencing development and environment. Finland supports the role of the UN as a key actor in international development policy and the efforts to pool all activity surrounding sustainable development within the UN. The proposal is to support the activities of the Panel by 300,000 euros in 2011.

iati-activity.title: Regional Industrial Pollution and CO2 Emission Abatement Project
iati-activity.description: Regional Industrial Pollution and CO2 Emission Abatement Project for Arab Countries (RIPECAP)was supported by the government of Finland and implemented by United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) in 2007-2009. Second phase in 2010-2011, capacity building and development of funding mechanisms in Egypt, Jordania and Morocco.

iati-activity.title: IDA16 replenishment
iati-activity.description: International Development Association IDA16 replenishment.

iati-activity.title: Cooperation with the academy of Finland
iati-activity.description: Development research administered by the Academy of Finland enables the maintenance of high-quality development research capacity in Finland and enhances cooperation with institutions from the South. Financing of multi-year research projects for 2010.

iati-activity.title: Cooperation with the academy of Finland
iati-activity.description: Development research administered by the Academy of Finland enables the maintenance of high-quality development research capacity in Finland and enhances cooperation with institutions from the South. Financing of multi-year research projects for 2011.

iati-activity.title: Commissioned development policy research 2010
iati-activity.description: Commissioned development policy research 2010. The purpose of the commissioned development policy research is to support the planning, decision making and implementation of Finland's development policy and development cooperation. The research is based on the information needs of the Ministry. The approach and particular emphasis of the projects are discussed with the researchers, without hampering their academic freedom. The duration of projects varies between 3-12 months. Each project is supported by a Steering Group consisting of sector and area experts. The results of projects are discussed in public seminars with the research community, civil servants and civil society actors.

iati-activity.title: UNESCO/Education for all
iati-activity.description: Memorandum of Understanding signed in 2003 between Unesco and the Governments of Denmark, Finland, Norway, Sweden and Iceland on support to Unesco's acitivites in the field of Education for All, determined to assist developing countries, with special concern for LDCs. Capacity Building for EFA (CapEFA) programme applies a programme approach by addressing key priority areas of the education sector's regular programme focusing within the general frameworks of LIFE (Literacy Initiative for Empowerment 2005-2015) and TTISSA (Teacher Training Initiative for Sub-Saharan Africa 2006-2015).
iati-activity.participating-org: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organisation (UNESCO)

iati-activity.title: WHO Humanitarian Health Action; capacity building
iati-activity.description: Strengthening WHO's capacity for Humanitarian Health Action, Programme for 2009-13
iati-activity.sector: Relief co-ordination; protection and support services

iati-activity.title: Training programme on development cooperation
iati-activity.description: Training programme on development cooperation in the Ministry for Foreign Affairs in 2010 aimed at the staff working in Helsinki and in the embassies. In addition, some courses available also to the experts recruited to international development cooperation work (especially JPO, UNV), funded from the Finnish development aid budjet.

iati-activity.title: Independent Diplomat, 2010
iati-activity.description: Moving forward from the largely disappointing outcomes of the Copenhagen Climate Summit in December 2009 the ID envisages ongoing and intensified provision of advice and assistance to AOSIS (Alliance of Small Islands States)and RMI (Republic of Marshall Islands)for the period 2010-11, helping to build momentum within and outside the negotiations towards the adoption of global environmentally credible agreement.

iati-activity.title: ICI project for Strengthening hydrometeorological Capacity in the Caribbean
iati-activity.description: The cooperation project between the Finnish Meteorological Institute and the Association of the Caribbean States (ACS) aims to strengthen the capacity and ability of the ACS member states to deal with natural disasters and adverse effects of climate change. Furthermore, the project identifies the needs for training and development of technical systems and formulates an action plan in 16 Caribbean states (Small Island Developing States, SIDS). The projects is submitted a funding of 500.000 euros. RE

iati-activity.title: Evaluation of the Results based approach and M6E in the Finnish Develo
iati-activity.description: The general purpose of the evaluation is to assess the planning, design, implementation and monitoring and evaluation of the bilateral projects and programs and also the methods and procedures adapted in case of new aid modalities, especially from the point of view of the results based approach and mechanisms. The objective is to deepen the understanding of the results-based approach and enhance internal learning and accoun tability, the use results-based mechanisms and management.

iati-activity.title: Predictability in Finnish Development Cooperation
iati-activity.description: The work aims to describe and analyse Finlands development co-operation budgeting framework, processes and instruments and country programming practices. The obejctive is to contribute to the work of the OECD/DAC Working party on aid effectiveness by sharing information and practices and by identifying key challenges.

iati-activity.title: Peer reviews and meta-analyses of development evaluations
iati-activity.description: Wide programme and thematic evaluations of development cooperation and their peer reviews and meta-analyses.

iati-activity.title: Evaluation of the Junior Professional Officer (JPO) Programme
iati-activity.description: In spite of its long history, the Finnish Junior Professional Officer (JPO) Programme has not been evaluated before. The purpose of this evaluation is to evaluate the JPO programme against the Finnish Development Policy and the objectives of the programme. In addition, the evaluation will assess the administrative implementation of the programme. The objective is to have a thorough evaluation of the Finnish JPO programme.

iati-activity.title: UN: Rio+20 and Global sustainability panel: support for preparations
iati-activity.description: The projects supports two processes: the preparations for the Rio+20 summit to be held in 2012 and for the UN Global sustainability panel, which gives recommendations for the Rio+20 conference. It is proposed that 53,859 euros are granted to the unit KEO-60 for strengthening the impact of multilateral cooperation.

iati-activity.title: Evaluation capacity development
iati-activity.description: The objective of the project is to strengthen evaluation capacity and systems in Finland and in the partner countries to improve the quality of evaluations, particularly the use of evaluation results in decision making. The project will be implemented by organising training in Finland and in the partner countries. Part of the capacity development will be implemented in cooperation with the OECD/DAC/EVALNET Task Team working on evaluation capacity development.

iati-activity.title: Evaluation of Private Sector and Trade Development
iati-activity.description: The main purpose of the evaluation is to assess the viability of the present AfT Action Plan and its implementation. The evaluation shall study also the relevance, efficiency and effectiveness as well as sustainability of the Finnish support to the sector.

iati-activity.title: Evaluation of country progarmmes
iati-activity.description: Overall evaluation of the cooperation programme of Finland of the main partner countries.

iati-activity.title: Training in chemical weapons verification
iati-activity.description: Evaluation of development programmes of the main partner countries financed by the Finnish ODA.

iati-activity.title: Evaluation of trade and development cooperation; preliminary study
iati-activity.description: Prepare a pre-study on Tade for Development, including collection and categorization of document material.

iati-activity.title: UNESCO/International institute for education planning
iati-activity.description: Support to UNESCO's International Institute for Educational Planning (IIEP). IIEP's mission is to assist Unesco Member States by strengthening their capacities to plan and manage their education systems in order to help them to achieve their goals in a sustainable manner. This mission requires a focus on policy-making as part of planning; and it demands attention to the implementation as well as the preparation of plans.
iati-activity.participating-org: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organisation (UNESCO)

iati-activity.title: Fund of the United Nations International Drug Control Programme UN
iati-activity.description: UNDCP is charged with the responsibility of coordinating and leading United Nations drug control activities.
iati-activity.participating-org: United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC)

iati-activity.title: Expert Consultation on the operationalisation of the Caribbean Sea Com
iati-activity.description: The Association of Caribbean States (ACS) endeavours to operationalise the structure of the Caribbean Sea Commission (CSC), which was established in 2008, in order to enable the Commission to fulfill its functions to acquire and synthesize information relevant to ocean governance in the Wider Caribbean Region. Finland extends financial support to an Expert Consultation on the operationalisation of the CSC, to be held in Barbados during the summer of 2010. Helcom will participate in the meeting as an expert and Finland will be represented at the national level.
iati-activity.sector: Water resources policy and administrative management

iati-activity.title: EBRD/Water Fund
iati-activity.description: The purpose of the Fund is to finance projects in the water sector in the countries of the Wider Europe Initiative. The projcets will be focused predominentely on providing assistance and support to the governments of the recipients countries carrying out regulatory work and reforms, using guidance of the UNECE/WHO Protocol on Water and Health and the EU Water Directive related to the management, use and preservation of water resources and activities related to the development and sustainable maintenance of safe water and sanitation facilities.
iati-activity.participating-org: European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD)

iati-activity.title: Promoting peaceful development and economic cooperation by increasing dialogue between cultures and civilizations through Anna Lindh Euro-Meditarranean Foundation.
iati-activity.description: The Anna Lindh Euro-Meditarranean Foundation for the Dialogue of Culture started its operation in 2005 with the purpose of promoting peaceful development and economic cooperation by increasing dialogue between cultures and civilizations. The projects of the ALF focus on human rights issues, good governance, sustainable development and education. A national coordinator is selected from each member country of the ALF in order to promote the objectives of the foundation and implement the projects. The national coordinator in Finland has previously been Tampere Peace Resarch Institute.

iati-activity.title: Support to the Human Rights and Business (IHRB)
iati-activity.description: The premise of the Institutes work is that economic, ecological and social sustainability needs to be underpinned by respect for the inherent dignity of humankind and the rights embodied in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, the two UN Human Rights Covenants and the relevant Conventions. The role of the private sector is a powerful corollary in determining the rate of progress towards some of the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and the United Nations endorsed Protect, Respect, Remedy Framework on Business and Human Rights represents a significant advance in efforts to ensure that private sector actors contribute to sustainable development and respect for fundamental rights.

iati-activity.title: Support to Small Arms Survey
iati-activity.description: The Small Arms Survey is an independent research project. It serves as the principal international source of public information on all aspects of small arms and as a resource for governments, policy-makers, researchers, and activists. Effective governmental or non-governmental action depends on a correct diagnosis of the problem, yet policy-makers, analysts, and activists often lack basic information concerning the production, transfer, stockpiling, and use of small arms and light weapons around the world.
